definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The fugitives could not have taken this as an encouraging sign.
sentences.chinese: 這些逃亡者並沒有被看作是鼓舞士氣的事件。

sentences.english: The order of commendation from the general headquarters lifted up still higher the morale of the troops.
sentences.chinese: 總司令部的嘉獎令大大地鼓舞了那個部隊的士氣。

sentences.english: For example, they are hugely demoralizing for teams.
sentences.chinese: 例如，工作團隊士氣十分低落。

sentences.english: The troops attacking frontally would do so with more enthusiasm .
sentences.chinese: 擔任正面進攻的部隊會士氣更高地向前挺進。

sentences.english: How does the squad's mood compare to that of the last few pre-seasons?
sentences.chinese: 現在球隊的士氣和前幾個賽季的準備期有什麼不同？

sentences.english: Morale in the Forest Department is at an all time low.
sentences.chinese: 林業部門的士氣一直很低。

sentences.english: Three employees have resigned this week-a clear sign that morale is low.
sentences.chinese: 三位員工在這個星期辭職，這是士氣低落的明顯徵兆。

sentences.english: The resulting conflicts in policy, and the continual changing of plans, soon demoralized the department.
sentences.chinese: 決策上的衝突，計劃的不斷變更很快使部門士氣受挫。

sentences.english: Please go on with your enthusiasm, your eagerness, and your high spirit.
sentences.chinese: 請保持你的激情，熱心和昂揚的士氣。

sentences.english: Morale is better with a more casual dress-code.
sentences.chinese: 比較寬鬆的服裝規定會有比較高昂的士氣。

sentences.english: If morale were sky high, I would be even more worried.
sentences.chinese: 如果員工士氣高漲，我還會更擔心一些。

sentences.english: Stories like these were invented to damage enemy morale.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的消息，向壁虛構，無非是要打擊敵方士氣。

sentences.english: Was released without bail, where the French Socialist Party Kahn morale.
sentences.chinese: 獲無保釋放後，卡恩所在的法國社會黨士氣大振。

sentences.english: Tired of the President's beady eyes starting at you all day in your government office?
sentences.chinese: 總統肖像成日目光如豆影響辦公室士氣怎辦？

sentences.english: The morale of the enemy soldiers degenerated, and they were unable to fight.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍士氣低落，所以他們不能戰鬥。

definition: to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
to try hard to/to strive to
